pull.title: tests: exclude all tests with difference parameters in `--exclude` list
pull.body: Fix broken exclusion list in functional tests. See https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/14007#pullrequestreview-158309105

rename.from: tests: exclude all tests with difference parameters
rename.to: tests: exclude all tests with difference parameters in `--exclude` list

events.body:
<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* #14320 ([bugfix] wallet: Fix duplicate fileid detection by ken2812221)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.
utACK with one request for a comment.

events.message: tests: exclude all tests with difference parameters

events.body: Couple of nits , but otherwise looks good.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -285,11 +285,12 @@ def main():
 
     # Remove the test cases that the user has explicitly asked to exclude.
     if args.exclude:
-        exclude_tests = [re.sub("\.py$", "", test) + (".py" if ".py" not in test else "") for test in args.exclude.split(',')]
+        exclude_tests = [re.sub("\.py$", "", test) for test in args.exclude.split(',')]
         for exclude_test in exclude_tests:
-            if exclude_test in test_list:
-                test_list.remove(exclude_test)
-            else:
+            exclude_list = [test for test in test_list if test.split('.py')[0] == exclude_test]
comments.body: Could probably do with a comment here to explain why you're doing this (removing `<test_name>.py` and `<test_name>.py --arg` from the test list)

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -285,11 +285,12 @@ def main():
 
     # Remove the test cases that the user has explicitly asked to exclude.
     if args.exclude:
-        exclude_tests = [re.sub("\.py$", "", test) + (".py" if ".py" not in test else "") for test in args.exclude.split(',')]
+        exclude_tests = [re.sub("\.py$", "", test) for test in args.exclude.split(',')]
comments.body: nit: could remove the use of the `re` module, since it is no longer required? `"foo.py".split('.py')[0] == "foo".split('.py')[0]`

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -285,11 +285,13 @@ def main():
 
     # Remove the test cases that the user has explicitly asked to exclude.
     if args.exclude:
-        exclude_tests = [re.sub("\.py$", "", test) + (".py" if ".py" not in test else "") for test in args.exclude.split(',')]
+        exclude_tests = [test.split('.py')[0] for test in args.exclude.split(',')]
comments.body: nit: I prefer `test.strip('.py')` just in case there's a very unlikely '.py' in the middle of a file name.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -285,11 +285,13 @@ def main():
 
     # Remove the test cases that the user has explicitly asked to exclude.
     if args.exclude:
-        exclude_tests = [re.sub("\.py$", "", test) + (".py" if ".py" not in test else "") for test in args.exclude.split(',')]
+        exclude_tests = [test.split('.py')[0] for test in args.exclude.split(',')]
         for exclude_test in exclude_tests:
-            if exclude_test in test_list:
-                test_list.remove(exclude_test)
-            else:
+            # Remove <test_name>.py and <test_name>.py --arg from the test list
+            exclude_list = [test for test in test_list if test.split('.py')[0] == exclude_test]
comments.body: nit: same as above. `test.strip('.py')` is preferable over `test.split('.py')[0]` and reads a little better.

     # Remove the test cases that the user has explicitly asked to exclude.
     if args.exclude:
-        exclude_tests = [re.sub("\.py$", "", test) + (".py" if ".py" not in test else "") for test in args.exclude.split(',')]
+        exclude_tests = [test.split('.py')[0] for test in args.exclude.split(',')]
